frameDefinitions: Two (or more) people (the Interlocutors, also encodable as Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2) talk to one another.
This frame describes food and meal preparation.
An Agent prepares for an Activity. '' 'The troops were preparing themselves for the mission.'
An Agent adjusts an Instrument to enable it to interact directly with a difficult-to-access Target_location.
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
frameExamples: I would rather <t>discuss</t> politics with anyone but him.
Caitlin <t>baked</t> some cookies from the pre-packaged dough.
The troops were <t>preparing</t> themselves for the mission.
If you <t>aim</t> your weapons somewhere else , I 'll be more likely to talk .
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
listRoleDefinitions: In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> is generally encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>.  Thus a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that of <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Interlocutors</fen> as a whole.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group.  It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <ment>with</ment>).  Note that it is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents. For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>.

In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role <fen>Interlocutors</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role <fen>Interlocutors</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Discussion frame, it is possible for the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.

<fen>Topic</fen> expresses the subject that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> are trying to come to some agreement about.  It may refer, for example, to an undesirable issue that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> want to have the proper response to, or it may refer more directly to an unresolved question.
The time at which the discussion takes place.
The location at which a discussion takes place.
The <fen>Cook</fen>  prepares the <fen>Produced_food</fen>.
The <fen>Produced_food</fen> is the result of a <fen>Cook</fen>'s efforts.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the cooking creation occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the cooking creation occurs.
An <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is preparing.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The individual that manipulates the <fen>Instrument</fen> to enable interaction with the <fen>Targeted</fen>.
The <fen>Targeted</fen> is the entity located in an indirectly accessible location relative to the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to interact with the <fen>Targeted</fen>.
The location that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to ready the <fen>Instrument</fen> to access.
The <fen>Activity</fen> is undertaken by the <fen>Agent</fen> and is directed towards the <fen>Targeted</fen> or <fen>Target_location</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> takes aim.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> aims at the <fen>Targeted</fen>.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The President</fex> conferred with his top advisor.
The President debated <fex>with his top advisor</fex>.
(1) <fex>The President and his advisor</fex> discussed the Venezuelan situation briefly before the summit.
The President and his top advisors discussed <fex>the scandal</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the participants discussed taking down the last trade barriers without consensus.
We just conferred for a couple of hours <fex>up in her room</fex>.
<fex>Drew</fex> cooked dinner for his friends.
Drew prepared <fex>dinner</fex> for his friends.
Drew baked an apple pie <fex>at six int he morning</fex>.
Drew prepared the soup <fex> in the kitchen</fex>.
I tried to target <fex>his left thigh</fex> .
If you target <fex>towards the bridge</fex> , make sure to avoid the church .
<fex>The attack</fex> targeted a village south of here.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years

sourceCandidateSpans.text: "Justin Bieber: First Step 2 Forever: My Story
